keywords: Laksa, Noodle Soup, Spicy Soup, Coconut Milk Soup, Southeast Asian Cuisine, Malaysian Cuisine, Singaporean Cuisine, Asian Noodles, Lemongrass, Chili Pepper, Kaffir Lime Leaves, Laksa Paste, Tom Yum Paste, Coconut Milk, Hokkien Noodles, Prawns, Chicken, Tofu, Main Course, Homemade Recipe, Spicy Broth, Aromatic Soup, Fish Sauce, Ginger, Coriander, Bean Sprouts, Comfort Food, Curry Laksa
description: Indulge in this homemade Laksa, a rich and aromatic Southeast Asian spicy noodle soup. This recipe features a creamy coconut milk broth infused with lemongrass, ginger, kaffir lime leaves, Laksa paste, and Tom Yum paste, offering a customisable experience with various optional fillings like chicken, prawns, tofu, and fresh vegetables, all topped with vibrant garnishes.

nutrition.calories: 700-1100 calories per serving (estimated, assumes 4-6 servings and includes noodles and some fillings)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot head up the oil and saute the lemongrass, minced ginger, onions, minced garlic, and some sliced chilis. After a few minutes add the laksa and tom yum pastes.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute aromatics

recipeInstructions.text: Stir continuously and add the fish sauce, sugar, lime leaves and chicken stock. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce it up

recipeInstructions.text: Add the coconut milk and simmer for aboutm 30 minutes. At this point you can either strain it for a nice clean broth or you can keep all the bits and not bother.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer and strain

recipeInstructions.text: Add whatever meat and veges to the broth to cook as required or prep them ahead of time to add on top. Serve with your garnishes and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with garnish

notes: I love this most on a cold winters day with some amazing char siu added on top.

As seen in the fillings and garnishes, really versatile and great to have with many different things. Really fantastic batch cooked and frozen and then brought out to clean out the fridge of leftover veg/meat.
For the best results, use fresh garlic, ginger and lemongrass. You can also use galangal if your hear so desires.
